question: Will the 7-day COVID-19 case average in the USA be above 200,000 again by August 1, 2022?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if the 7-day COVID-19 Case average is above 200,000 in the US for any day ranging from May 5, 2022, to August 1, 2022, inclusive, and “No” otherwise. The resolution source for this market is the CDC: https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#trends_dailycases.

To account for potential data revisions and/or incompleteness: the market will be checked daily at 8 PM ET to see if any day within the aforementioned range has a 7-day COVID-19 case average above 200,000. These daily checks will occur from May 5, 2022, to August 8, 2022 (inclusive). If an average above 200,000 is detected, it will be checked again 7 days later. If it is still above 200,000 at that point, the market will be resolved. If it is 200,000 or below, then the market will not resolve based on that data point.

question: Will $ETH be above $2,700 on May 14, 2022?
description:
This is a market on if the price of Ethereum (ETH) will be above $2,700 in USD on May 14, 2022 (12 PM ET). 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if Ethereum ($ETH) has a candlestick closing price of $2,700.01 or more, as per the resolution source, on May 14, 2022, 12 PM ET, and “No” otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/ethereum).

This market will resolve according to the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Sat 14 May 2022, 12:00:00”, with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 12:00:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:30:00 AM ET and the closing price for 12:00:00 PM ET.

The check will be at 12:30 PM ET, May 14, 2022.

question: Will the 7-day COVID-19 case average in the USA be below 50,000 by May 31?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if the 7-day COVID-19 Case average is below 50,000 in the US for any day ranging from May 6, 2022 to May 31, 2022 inclusive, and “No” otherwise. The resolution source for this market is the CDC; https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#trends_dailycases. 

To account for potential data revisions and/or incompleteness: the market will be checked daily at 8 PM ET to see if any day within the aforementioned range has a 7-day COVID-19 case average below 50,000. These daily checks will occur from May 7, 2022 to June 7, 2022 (inclusive). If an average below 50,000 is detected, it will be checked again 7 days later. If it is still under 50,000 at that point, the market will be resolved. If it is 50,000 or above, then the market will not resolve based on that data point.

question: Will Canelo Álvarez KO/TKO/RTD Dmitry Bivol?
description:
Canelo Álvarez vs. Dmitry Bivol, billed as Legacy is Earned, is an upcoming professional boxing match between 4-division world champion, Canelo Álvarez, and defending WBA (Super) light heavyweight champion, Dmitry Bivol. The fight will take place on May 7, 2022.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if Canelo Álvarez wins by KO/TKO/RTD and "No" otherwise.

If the fight is rescheduled to a time and date on or before May 14, 2022, the same rules will apply. If the fight is postponed to a date after May 14, 2022, or cancelled altogether, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Who will win Canelo Álvarez vs. Dmitry Bivol?
description:
Canelo Álvarez vs. Dmitry Bivol, billed as Legacy is Earned, is an upcoming professional boxing match between 4-division world champion, Canelo Álvarez, and defending WBA (Super) light heavyweight champion, Dmitry Bivol. The fight will take place on May 7, 2022.

If Canelo Álvarez wins this fight, this market will resolve to "Álvarez". If Dmitry Bivol wins this fight, this market will resolve to "Bivol".

question: Senate: Will a Democrat (Ryan) or Republican (Vance) win in Ohio?
description:
This market will resolve to “Democrat” if the candidate who wins the 2022 Ohio U.S. Senate election is representing the Democratic Party, or to “Republican” if the candidate who wins the 2022 Ohio U.S. Senate election is representing the Republican Party. 

A candidate shall be considered to represent a party in the event that he or she is the nominee, or has a ballot-listed or otherwise identifiable party preference, of the party in question.

If the winning candidate is from a party other than the Democratic or the Republican party, the market will resolve to 50-50.

Determination of the winner of the Senate election will be based on a consensus of credible reporting, or if there is ambiguity, final state election authority certification or other final official determination of the 2022 election results.
groupItemTitle: Ohio - Tim Ryan vs. J. D. Vance

events.title: 2022 U.S. Senate elections: Will a Democrat or Republican win this state?

question: Will Charles Herbster win the Republican gubernatorial nomination in the 2022 Nebraska election on May 10?
description:
The 2022 Nebraska gubernatorial election will take place on November 8, 2022, to elect the governor of Nebraska. Incumbent Republican Governor Pete Ricketts is term-limited and cannot seek a third term. 

A primary election is an election in which registered voters select a candidate that they believe should be a political party's candidate for elected office to run in the general election. In Nebraska, a top-two primary system is used for the nonpartisan legislature and some other statewide races. All other primaries are semi-closed. Nebraska's primary elections are currently scheduled for May 10.

This is a market on whether Charles Herbster will win the Republican nomination for Governor of Nebraska. The primary election is scheduled to take place on May 10, 2022.

If Charles Herbster wins the Republican nomination for Governor of Nebraska, this market will resolve to “Yes”. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

Determination of the Republican nominee for the 2022 election for the Governor of Nebraska will be based on a consensus of credible reporting, or if there is ambiguity, the final state election authority certification or other final official determination of the 2022 election results.

If for any reason, the Republican nominee is not known by June 10, 2022 (11 PM ET), this market will resolve to 50/50.
